articles.title: Argentine corn starts key development stage with rainfall boost, exchange says
articles.description: By Maximilian HeathBUENOS AIRES, Nov 18 (Reuters) - Early planted corn in Argentina has begun key development stages, during which yields are determined, with "good expectations" thanks to recent rains, the Buenos Aires grains exchange said on Thursday.The exchange expects Argentina's 2021/22 corn crop at a record 55 million tonnes.
articles.content:
By Maximilian Heath

articles.title: Uruguay in disarray. “It’s a gulf in every aspect”
articles.description: The Uruguay national team lost their fourth consecutive match in the World Cup qualifiers and fell out of the play-off zone. Not only is their performance in Qatar hanging in the balance, but also the fate of the legendary coach Oscar Tabarez. After disastrous defeats against Argentina and Brazil (0-3 and 1-4 respectively, although it […]
articles.content:

articles.title: France's Flament trod unusual path to facing the All Blacks
articles.description: Living in Belgium, playing for an English university's fifth team and working in Argentina for a year is not the most orthodox route to facing the All Blacks.
articles.content:

articles.title: Soccer-Brazil v Argentina match officials suspended for 'serious errors'
articles.description:
The referee and the Video Assistant Referee (VAR) who officiated in Tuesday's World Cup qualifier between Brazil and Argentina have been suspended for "serious errors", the South American soccer governing body CONMEBOL said.
The 0-0 draw allowed Argentina to join Brazil in sealing qualification for the World Cup in Qatar next year.
